    @allure.feature("User Authentication")
    @allure.story("User Logout")
    @pytest.mark.ui
    def test_logout(page: Page, home_page):
        """
        Test Case: User can logout successfully.
        Validates that the user menu disappears after logout.
        """
        # Create a fresh user via API
        user_email = fake.email()
        user_data = {
            "first_name": fake.first_name(),
            "last_name": fake.last_name(),
            "email": user_email,
            "password": "Test1234!@",
            "dob": "1990-01-01",
            "phone": "5555555555",
            "address": {
                "street": fake.street_address(),
                "city": fake.city(),
                "state": fake.state(),
                "country": "US",
                "postal_code": "12345"
            }
        }
        requests.post("https://api.practicesoftwaretesting.com/users/register", json=user_data)
    
        with allure.step("1. Navigate to Login Page"):
            page.goto("/auth/login")
            page.wait_for_load_state("networkidle")
    
        with allure.step("2. Login with valid credentials"):
            page.locator("[data-test='email']").fill(user_email)
            page.locator("[data-test='password']").fill("Test1234!@")
            page.locator("[data-test='login-submit']").click()
    
            # Wait for successful login - look for user menu or account link
            page.wait_for_timeout(2000)
    
        with allure.step("3. Click on User Menu and Logout"):
            # Click on the user/account dropdown
>           page.locator("[data-test='nav-user-menu']").click()

    async def wrap_api_call(
        self, cb: Callable[[], Any], is_internal: bool = False
    ) -> Any:
        if self._api_zone.get():
            return await cb()
        task = asyncio.current_task(self._loop)

        self._api_zone.set(parsed_st)
